author: Super kitty to the rescue
title: Not recommended
content:
I live in a remote town and commuting to the nearest cash deposit location is more than 40 minutes one way. Half of the deposit locations are located in slums, in unsafe parts of town, and several locations are closed down. 
Several locations listed on the square app to make cash deposits have turned me away because they have no idea what I am trying to accomplish. 
The locations that I have used only allow $200-$300 deposits per day. Same locations seem to change the maximum amount of cash deposit based on the person taking in to cash deposit at the register. I find myself having to chase up to 3 or 4 places in one trip trying to make these deposits which never work because either the location is no longer in business, or the employees or managers have no idea that they are registered to take in deposits for square. And carrying so much cash on my person from place to place to include parts of town that are in bad locations puts me, a single woman, at significant risk. 
Final straw: Today, I called to ask customer service to let me know which location would allow me to make the most / max cash deposit in one transaction. 4 transfers later, all refused to get a manager or supervisor. 
Square does not care for their customers and their customer service agents are not qualified to take calls beyond the scope of their scripted and pre-programmed FAQs. 
I have a unique situation and I called to get a resolution only to be told that I don‚Äôt have a reason that is acceptable to talk to a manager or supervisor. 
As a small business owner, disabled veteran of the US Armed Forces, woman, and minority, the lack of support in square advertised services is dangerous and Square representatives do not care. I have worked hard like many entrepreneurs to get my business started and going. In under a year, 6months using a square checking and saving account, my Square debit card was hacked while it sat in my wallet, several attempted charges on the debit card. I followed the procedure to cancel the debit card and ordered a new card that never came in the mail. When I called to check, I was told the new card was never ordered.
I had a transaction that needed to be refunded. As my first time making a refund, the process did not complete (no idea why not) and when I called square to follow up, I was informed that there is only 1 opportunity to process a refund and if that doesn‚Äôt complete then there is no other way to process a refund. 
Taking the square route for business banking is the worst decision by far as a new storefront owner. Neighboring small businesses all advised against square but I gave it a chance- I had to borrow a loan for start up funding to purchase the Square Point of Purchase Terminal. This is the most stressful debacle as a small business in under 9 months with this new business venture. I do not recommend square to any business.
